dct_title_s: Mappe-monde geo-hydrographique, ou description generale du globe terrestre et aquatique, en deux plans-hemispheres, ou sont exactement remarquees en general toutes les parties de la terre et de l'eau, suivant les relations les plus novelles
dct_description_sm: Par le Sr. Sanson, Geographe Ordinaire du Roy; Hubert Iaillot, Geographe de Sa Majeste.
California shown as a labeled island with an indented northern coast and some coastal place names.
Great lakes are shown open to the west. A partial outline of New Zealand is shown.
Limited decoration. Two angels hold a royal coat of arms at top between two hemispheres with a small cartouche directly below. A decorative cartouche at bottom surrounded by sea creatures.

Title at top with "169." below it. Top cartouche - "Dedie au Roy. Par son tres-humble, tres-obeissant, et tres-fidele Sujet, et Serviteur, Hubert Jaillot Geographe de Sa Majeste." Bottom cartouche - "A Paris Chez H. Iaillot, Geographe du Roy joignant les Grands Augustins, aux deux Globes Avec Privilege du Roy...169." Below western hemisphere - "Cordier, Sculpsit".
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
